meanings.definition: To make less difficult or severe
meanings.sent1: Taking breaks eases the stress of studying for exams.
meanings.sent2: Gentle stretching eases muscle tension after a workout.
meanings.sent3: His calming presence eases the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: Kind words can ease the burden of a heavy heart.
meanings.sent5: A warm bath eases the aches and pains of a long day.

meanings.sent5: He eases the door open, hoping not to wake the sleeping baby.
